prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: CO(3-2) for sdss_j1106+1939 and sdss_j1122+1645
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This Science Goal is to obtain CO(3-2) spectroscopy for two hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47.0, 47.2) QSOs at z~3. To optimize calibration times and overheads we will use the same spectroscopic setup for both sources since their redshifts are very close (3.038 and 3.031). We aim at a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to secure detections of lines brighter than 1mJy. In baseband 2 we will observe HCN(4-3) while baseband 3 and 4 are for the continuum.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for 300 km/s rms to secure a detection of CO(3-2) lines brighter than 0.8-1 mJy based on previous detections of sources of similar luminosity and redshift. In fact, the only four hyper-luminous QSOs detected so far in CO have CO(3-2) or CO(4-3) fluxes higher than 1 mJy. This sensitivity limit imply an upper limit on SFE of ~ 350 if the SFR is as low as 500 Msun/yr (the SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr).
The proposed observations will map CO on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to 8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover CO(3-2), baseband 2 HCN(4-3) while baseband 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~49min for a total of 1.49h including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: [CII] and continuum of sdss_j1106+1939 and sdss_j1122+1645
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This Science Goal is to obtain CO(3-2) spectroscopy for two hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47.0, 47.2) QSOs at z~3. To optimize calibration times and overheads we will use the same spectroscopic setup for both sources since their redshifts are very close (3.038 and 3.031). We aim at a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to secure detections of lines brighter than 1mJy. In baseband 1 we will observe the [CII] line while baseband 2, 3 and 4 are for the continuum.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.5mJy on the continuum and 1.5mJy on the [CII] line for 300 km/s rms to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect lines brighter than 7-8mJy. The SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr.
The two [CII] detections of hyper-luminous QSOs are of the order of 8-20mJy
The proposed observations will map [CII] and continuum on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to 8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover [CII], baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~27min for a total of 1.07h including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: CO(4-3) in 2 z=3.5 QSOs (sdss_j1538+0855 and sdss_j1555+1003)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This Science Goal is to obtain CO(4-3) spectroscopy for two hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47.0) QSOs at z~3.5. To optimize calibration times and overheads we will use the same spectroscopic setup for both sources since their redshifts are very close (3.551 and 3.512). We aim at a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to secure detections of lines brighter than 1mJy. In baseband 1 we will observe CO(4-3) while baseband 2, 3 and 4 are for the continuum.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for 300 km/s rms to secure a detection of CO(4-3) lines brighter than 0.8-1 mJy based on previous detections of sources of similar luminosity and redshift. In fact, the only four hyper-luminous QSOs detected so far in CO have CO(3-2) or CO(4-3) fluxes higher than 1 mJy. This sensitivity limit imply an upper limit on SFE of ~ 350 if the SFR is as low as 500 Msun/yr (the SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr).
The proposed observations will map CO on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to ~8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover CO(4-3), while baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above.
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~42min for a total of 1.34h including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: [CII] and 160um continuum for sdss_j1538+0855
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
This Science Goal is to obtain [CII] and 160um continumm through spectroscopy for one hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47) QSOs at z~3.5.
We aim at a sensitivity of 0.5mJy in the continuum at 160um and 1mJy on the [CII] line for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect a line brighter than 5mJy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.5mJy on the continuum and 1.0mJy on the [CII] line for 300 km/s rms to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect lines brighter than 7-8mJy. The SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr.
The two [CII] detections of hyper-luminous QSOs are of the order of 8-20mJy
The proposed observations will map [CII] and continuum on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to 8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover [CII], baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~6min for a total of 31.9m including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: [CII] and 160um continuum for sdss_j1555+1003
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
This Science Goal is to obtain [CII] and 160um continumm through spectroscopy for one hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47) QSOs at z~3.5.
We aim at a sensitivity of 0.5mJy in the continuum at 160um and 1.5mJy on the [CII] line for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect a line brighter than 7-8mJy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.5mJy on the continuum and 1.5mJy on the [CII] line for 300 km/s rms to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect lines brighter than 7-8mJy. The SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr.
The two [CII] detections of hyper-luminous QSOs are of the order of 8-20mJy
The proposed observations will map [CII] and continuum on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to 8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover [CII], baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~5min for a total of 30.9m including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: CO(4-3) sdss_j1639+2824
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
This Science Goal is to obtain CO(4-3) spectroscopy for a hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47.5) QSOs at z~3.8.
We aim at a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to secure detections of lines brighter than 1 mJy. In baseband 2, 3 and 4 we will observe the continuum.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.2mJy for 300 km/s rms to secure a detection of CO(4-3) lines brighter than 0.8-1 mJy based on previous detections of sources of similar luminosity and redshift. In fact, the only four hyper-luminous QSOs detected so far in CO have CO(3-2) or CO(4-3) fluxes higher than 1 mJy. This sensitivity limit imply an upper limit on SFE of ~ 350 if the SFR is as low as 500 Msun/yr (the SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr).
The proposed observations will map CO on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to ~8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover CO(4-3), while baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above.
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~19min for a total of 47.6m including calibrations and overheads.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: [CII] and 160um continuum for sdss_j1639+2824
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
This Science Goal is to obtain [CII] and 160um continumm through spectroscopy for one hyper-luminous (lgL(7.8um)~47.5) QSOs at z~3.8.
We aim at a sensitivity of 0.5mJy in the continuum at 160um and 1.0mJy on the [CII] line for a line width of 300 km/s rms. This will allow us to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect a line brighter than 5mJy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
We request a sensitivity of 0.5mJy on the continuum and 1.0mJy on the [CII] line for 300 km/s rms to measure SFR as low as 500Msun/yr and detect lines brighter than 5mJy. The SFRs measured from the submm continuum of three hyper-luminous QSOs similar to our sources are all in excess of 1000Msun/yr.
The two [CII] detections of hyper-luminous QSOs are of the order of 8-20mJy
The proposed observations will map [CII] and continuum on arcsec scale. At the redshift of the target, this corresponds to 8kpc. Therefore we will not likely resolve the inner molecular disk but we might be able to resolve the faint extended structures of complex merging systems on scales>10kpc.
Correlator setup: We use four basebands of 1.875GHz and a spectral resolution of 27km/s. Baseband 1 will cover [CII], baseband 2, 3 and 4 will be used to observe the continuum.
The data will be binned to reach the sensitivity mentioned above
Standard calibration requested.
The total on source time requested for this Science Goal is ~7min for a total of 36.8m including calibrations and overheads.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The most luminous QSOs in the Universe at z=2-4, hosting SMBH of >10^9 Msun, are likely the cradles of local giant galaxies. Despite their astrophysical importance they are still little studied in the sub-mm band. We propose to exploit the ALMA sensitivity to fill this gap by targeting 5 of the most luminous QSOs discovered by WISE at 22um. All our targets are BALQSOs with strong outflows of ionized gas. Our aim is to probe: (i) CO(3-2) for two QSOs at z~3, CO(4-3) for three QSOs at z=3.5-3.8; and [CII] and the nearby continuum to measure gas mass, SFR, and dynamical mass; and (ii) any outflowing molecular gas in the wings of [CII] and CO lines. The proposed observations are standard but applied to a unique sample and will allow us to: a) test if the AGN feedback has been already efficient in expelling gas; b) measure the gas consumption time to constrain the star-formation mode (starburst vs quiescent) of QSO host galaxies; c) locate the high luminosity QSOs in the MBHMgal diagram compared to the tracks which lead to the formation of local giant galaxies. Our results will provide a benchmark for our understanding of the AGN-host galaxy interplay during the luminous QSO phase.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
